title: Picks wrong MPI for mfem but not other packages
body:
In my packages.py I have 

```
    openmpi:
        paths:
            openmpi@2.0.1: /usr/local
        version: [system]
        buildable: False        
```

and 

```
    all:
        providers:
            # prefer OpenMPI over MPICH by default
            mpi: [openmpi, mpich]
```

Now in a clean spack directory (after git clean -x -f -d) I get 

```
$ ./bin/spack install mpi
==> openmpi is externally installed in /usr/local
~/Src/spack (develop=) 
$ ./bin/spack install hypre
==> Installing hypre
==> netlib-lapack is externally installed in /usr
==> openmpi is externally installed in /usr/local
==> Fetching http://computation.llnl.gov/project/linear_solvers/download/hypre-2.11.1.tar.gz
.... Builds hypre fine

~/Src/spack (develop=) 
$ ./bin/spack install mfem
==> Installing mfem
==> Installing mvapich2
==> Installing libpciaccess
==> Installing util-macros
Starts the massive project of installing mvapich2 and its dependencies.
```

Spack is fantasizing  that it should use some wacked out MPI mvapich2 instead of the default. This happens with mfem but not with hypre, petsc, superlu_dist, mumps ... 

This is the develop branch on my Mac.

Not if you use ./bin/spack install mfem+mpi then it does use the OpenMPI. mfem/package.py does have a default dependence on mpi 

`    variant('mpi', default=True, description='Activate support for MPI')`

so there is something wrong with how Spack selects the MPI when it is not provided on the command line for the install.
